alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 28 at 3:06PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: A strong low pressure system will push a frontal system towards Kodiak Island this evening this will bring strong easterly winds and snow changing to rain. This is expected to be the first accumulating snowfall for the Kodiak City area. Light to moderate snow will begin later this evening before 9 pm and continue through midnight or shortly thereafter with brief periods of heavy snow possible. Expect 1 to 3 inches of snow before it changes over to rain near midnight as warmer air moves off the relatively warmer ocean. Additionally, periods of blowing snow is possible with occasional periods of visibilities of one mile or less. If traveling around the Kodiak area be prepared for slippery roads and reduced visibilities.
